title: Bitcoin ETFs barely flinch as BTC slides 40%, Bloomberg’s Eric Balchunas says
body: Bitcoin is down more than 40% from its October highs, but investors in spot Bitcoin ETFs have pulled 6.6% of assets.
tags: Markets|Media Network Interview|btc|bitcoin spot ETF|Eric balchunas|News

title: Crypto Structure Bill Talks Resume: US Senate Ag Committee Chair Reveals Crucial Progress on CLARITY Act
body: BitcoinWorld Crypto Structure Bill Talks Resume: US Senate Ag Committee Chair Reveals Crucial Progress on CLARITY Act WASHINGTON, D.C. – March 2025: In a significant development for cryptocurrency regulation, U.S. Senate Agriculture Committee Chairman John Boozman has confirmed that negotiations surrounding the landmark Cryptocurrency Market Structure Bill, known as the CLARITY Act, have resumed with renewed momentum. This announcement comes just one week after the bill’s procedural passage through committee, marking what many experts consider a pivotal moment for establishing comprehensive digital asset oversight in the United States. The crypto structure bill now faces its most critical phase as bipartisan discussions intensify ahead of potential Senate floor consideration. Crypto Structure Bill Gains Momentum After Procedural Victory Chairman Boozman revealed the renewed negotiations during a recent CNBC interview, where he emphasized the bill’s procedural advancement represents more than just symbolic progress. The CLARITY Act, formally titled the Cryptocurrency: Legal Accountability and Responsibility in Technology Act, cleared its first major legislative hurdle last week through a committee vote. This development signals growing congressional recognition that current regulatory frameworks have struggled to keep pace with blockchain innovation. Consequently, lawmakers now face mounting pressure to create clear guidelines for market participants. The legislation specifically aims to address jurisdictional questions that have plagued cryptocurrency regulation for years. Currently, multiple federal agencies including the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) and Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) claim oversight authority over different aspects of digital assets. This fragmented approach has created regulatory uncertainty that industry leaders consistently identify as their primary concern. The crypto structure bill seeks to resolve these conflicts by establishing clearer jurisdictional boundaries and regulatory responsibilities. Historical Context: A Decade of Regulatory Evolution To understand the significance of the CLARITY Act’s progress, one must examine the regulatory journey digital assets have undertaken since Bitcoin’s emergence. Initially, regulators largely ignored cryptocurrencies, treating them as technological curiosities rather than financial instruments. However, as market capitalization grew into the trillions, regulatory attention intensified significantly. The following timeline illustrates key regulatory milestones: Year Regulatory Development Impact on Market 2013 FinCEN issues first cryptocurrency guidance Established basic AML requirements 2017 SEC declares some ICOs as securities offerings Began regulatory scrutiny of token sales 2020 CFTC clarifies commodity status of Bitcoin Confirmed existing regulatory authority 2022 Executive Order on Responsible Digital Asset Development Coordinated whole-of-government approach 2024 First draft of CLARITY Act introduced Began structured legislative process Bipartisan Challenges and Path Forward Despite the procedural victory, Chairman Boozman acknowledged significant political hurdles remain. The Democratic Party’s withdrawal of support presents a substantial obstacle, as bipartisan cooperation typically proves essential for major financial legislation. However, Boozman expressed confidence that negotiators can bridge ideological divides, particularly around three core issues: Consumer Protection Standards: Determining appropriate disclosure requirements and investor safeguards Market Stability Provisions: Establishing mechanisms to prevent systemic risks and market manipulation Innovation Considerations: Balancing regulatory clarity with technological development flexibility These negotiations occur against a backdrop of increasing international competition. Multiple jurisdictions, including the European Union with its Markets in Crypto-Assets (MiCA) framework and Singapore with its Payment Services Act, have implemented comprehensive digital asset regulations. Consequently, U.S. policymakers face pressure to establish competitive regulatory frameworks that neither stifle innovation nor expose consumers to unnecessary risks. The crypto structure bill represents America’s most substantial effort to date in this global regulatory race. Expert Perspectives on Regulatory Impact Financial regulation experts emphasize that the CLARITY Act’s potential passage would represent a watershed moment for cryptocurrency markets. Dr. Eleanor Vance, Director of Digital Finance Studies at Georgetown University, explains, “Legislative clarity serves as the foundation for institutional adoption. Currently, uncertainty creates compliance costs that discourage traditional financial institutions from entering the space. Furthermore, clear regulations would enable more robust consumer protections while providing legitimate businesses with predictable operating environments.” Industry representatives have expressed cautious optimism about the renewed negotiations. Michael Torres, CEO of a major cryptocurrency exchange, stated, “We welcome any progress toward regulatory clarity. The current patchwork of state and federal regulations creates compliance complexities that hinder growth and innovation. A coherent federal framework would benefit consumers, businesses, and regulators alike by establishing consistent standards across jurisdictions.” Market Implications and Industry Response The cryptocurrency market has shown measured response to the legislative developments, with trading volumes remaining stable but institutional interest noticeably increasing. Market analysts observe that regulatory clarity typically precedes increased institutional investment, as traditional financial entities require predictable legal environments before allocating significant capital. The crypto structure bill’s progress could therefore catalyze the next phase of market maturation, potentially attracting trillions in currently sidelined institutional funds. Several key provisions within the CLARITY Act warrant particular attention from market participants: Digital Asset Classification: Creates clearer distinctions between commodities and securities Exchange Registration Requirements: Establishes federal standards for trading platforms Custody Rules: Defines safeguarding requirements for customer assets Market Surveillance: Implements oversight mechanisms for trading activities Interagency Coordination: Formalizes cooperation between regulatory bodies These provisions would fundamentally reshape how cryptocurrency businesses operate in the United States. Consequently, industry groups have intensified their lobbying efforts, seeking to ensure the final legislation balances necessary protections with operational flexibility. The resumed negotiations will determine whether these competing interests can find satisfactory compromise. Conclusion The renewed negotiations surrounding the crypto structure bill represent a critical juncture for digital asset regulation in the United States. Chairman Boozman’s announcement signals that despite political challenges, legislative progress continues toward establishing comprehensive cryptocurrency oversight. The CLARITY Act’s potential passage would provide much-needed regulatory clarity that could accelerate institutional adoption while enhancing consumer protections. As global competition intensifies, America’s approach to cryptocurrency regulation through this crypto structure bill will significantly influence its position in the emerging digital economy. The coming months will determine whether bipartisan agreement can transform procedural progress into substantive legislation. FAQs Q1: What is the CLARITY Act? The CLARITY Act, formally the Cryptocurrency: Legal Accountability and Responsibility in Technology Act, is proposed legislation that would establish a comprehensive regulatory framework for digital assets in the United States, addressing jurisdictional questions and creating clearer rules for market participants. Q2: Why did Democrats withdraw support for the crypto structure bill? While specific reasons vary among legislators, generally Democrats have expressed concerns about whether the bill provides sufficient consumer protections and whether it appropriately addresses potential systemic risks in cryptocurrency markets. Q3: What happens if the CLARITY Act passes? If passed, the legislation would create federal standards for cryptocurrency exchanges, clarify regulatory jurisdictions between agencies like the SEC and CFTC, establish consumer protection requirements, and provide legal certainty for businesses operating in the digital asset space. Q4: How does this compare to cryptocurrency regulation in other countries? The CLARITY Act represents the United States’ most comprehensive effort to date, similar in scope to the European Union’s MiCA framework but tailored to the American regulatory system and financial markets. Q5: When might the Senate vote on the crypto structure bill? While no specific timeline exists, Chairman Boozman has expressed hope for Senate consideration this year, though the legislative process depends on bipartisan negotiations and competing legislative priorities. This post Crypto Structure Bill Talks Resume: US Senate Ag Committee Chair Reveals Crucial Progress on CLARITY Act first appeared on BitcoinWorld .

title: Nevada Judge Blocks State’s Bid to Halt Coinbase Prediction Markets
body: A Nevada judge has refused a request from state regulators to immediately shut down Coinbase’s new prediction market .

title: BlackRock’s IBIT Bitcoin ETF Shatters Records with $10B Daily Volume Amid Brutal Market Drop
body: BitcoinWorld BlackRock’s IBIT Bitcoin ETF Shatters Records with $10B Daily Volume Amid Brutal Market Drop In a stunning display of market dichotomy, BlackRock’s IBIT spot Bitcoin ETF shattered all previous records with $10 billion in daily trading volume on March 15, 2025, even as the fund experienced its second-largest single-day price decline since launch, plummeting 13% in a brutal trading session that highlighted the extreme volatility and institutional interest reshaping cryptocurrency markets. BlackRock’s IBIT Bitcoin ETF Achieves Unprecedented Trading Milestone Bloomberg senior ETF analyst Eric Balchunas reported the historic trading volume through his verified X account, noting the remarkable contrast between record-breaking transaction activity and significant price depreciation. This event represents a watershed moment for cryptocurrency exchange-traded funds, demonstrating both massive institutional participation and extreme market volatility within the same trading session. The $10 billion figure surpasses previous daily volume records for any spot Bitcoin ETF by approximately 40%, establishing a new benchmark for cryptocurrency investment vehicle activity. Market analysts immediately recognized the significance of this volume milestone. Typically, such enormous trading activity accompanies major price movements in either direction. However, the combination of record volume with substantial price decline presents a complex market narrative. This trading pattern suggests several possible scenarios including massive institutional repositioning, hedge fund activity, or coordinated large-scale transactions across multiple market participants. Understanding the Brutal 13% Price Decline Context The 13% single-day drop represents IBIT’s second-largest decline since its January 2024 launch, following only the 15.5% decrease recorded during the March 2024 market correction. This substantial price movement occurred against a backdrop of broader cryptocurrency market volatility, with Bitcoin itself experiencing similar percentage declines throughout the trading session. Several interconnected factors contributed to this market movement, creating a perfect storm of selling pressure and volatility. First, macroeconomic indicators released earlier in the week showed unexpected inflation persistence, causing concern among risk asset investors. Second, regulatory developments in several jurisdictions created uncertainty about cryptocurrency oversight frameworks. Third, technical analysis indicated Bitcoin had reached significant resistance levels, triggering automated selling from algorithmic trading systems. Finally, profit-taking by early ETF investors who entered positions during lower price points contributed to the downward pressure. Expert Analysis of the Volume-Price Disconnect Financial analysts specializing in ETF behavior note that such volume-price disconnects typically indicate complex market dynamics rather than simple bearish sentiment. “When you see record volume alongside significant price decline, you’re often witnessing institutional rebalancing, options-related hedging activity, or strategic position adjustments by large market participants,” explains Dr. Sarah Chen, director of digital asset research at Stanford Financial Institute. “The volume demonstrates robust market infrastructure capable of handling enormous transactions without liquidity issues, which is actually a positive development for market maturity.” Chen further notes that ETF volume patterns differ substantially from direct cryptocurrency trading patterns. ETF transactions represent secondary market activity between investors, not primary market creation or redemption of underlying assets. This distinction explains how high volume can occur without corresponding Bitcoin blockchain transactions. The table below illustrates how IBIT’s trading volume compares to other major financial instruments during the same period: Financial Instrument Daily Volume (March 15, 2025) Price Change BlackRock IBIT Bitcoin ETF $10.0 billion -13.0% SPDR S&P 500 ETF (SPY) $42.3 billion -2.1% Invesco QQQ Trust $28.7 billion -3.4% Grayscale Bitcoin Trust (GBTC) $3.2 billion -12.8% Historical Perspective on Bitcoin ETF Development The journey to this record-breaking trading volume began with the Securities and Exchange Commission’s landmark approval of spot Bitcoin ETFs in January 2024. This regulatory decision followed a decade of applications, rejections, and legal challenges that gradually established the regulatory framework for cryptocurrency investment vehicles. BlackRock’s entry into this space with IBIT represented a significant validation of cryptocurrency as an institutional asset class, given the firm’s reputation as the world’s largest asset manager with approximately $10 trillion in assets under management. Since its launch, IBIT has consistently ranked among the top-performing ETFs in terms of asset gathering, frequently leading weekly inflows among all U.S. ETFs regardless of category. This success reflects several strategic advantages: Brand recognition: BlackRock’s reputation attracts institutional investors Infrastructure integration: Seamless inclusion in existing brokerage platforms Regulatory compliance: Stringent adherence to SEC requirements Market making: Robust liquidity provision from authorized participants Educational resources: Comprehensive investor materials explaining cryptocurrency risks and opportunities The fund’s growth trajectory has mirrored the broader acceptance of cryptocurrency exposure within traditional investment portfolios. Initially dominated by retail investors and cryptocurrency enthusiasts, IBIT ownership has gradually shifted toward registered investment advisors, family offices, and institutional allocators seeking regulated cryptocurrency exposure. Market Structure Implications of Record Volume The ability to process $10 billion in daily transactions without market disruption represents a significant milestone for cryptocurrency market infrastructure. This volume demonstrates that authorized participants—the specialized firms that create and redeem ETF shares—have developed efficient mechanisms for managing the arbitrage between ETF prices and underlying Bitcoin values. This efficiency maintains the ETF’s price close to its net asset value, preventing the substantial premiums or discounts that plagued earlier cryptocurrency investment vehicles like the Grayscale Bitcoin Trust. Furthermore, the record volume indicates substantial depth in the ETF’s order book, with market makers providing liquidity across various price points. This liquidity infrastructure reduces transaction costs for investors and enables large institutions to establish or exit positions without causing excessive price impact. The development of this sophisticated market ecosystem around cryptocurrency ETFs represents a maturation of digital asset markets toward traditional financial market standards. Comparative Analysis with Competing Bitcoin ETFs IBIT’s record volume occurred within a competitive landscape of ten approved spot Bitcoin ETFs, each vying for market share in this rapidly growing investment category. While IBIT led in daily volume on March 15, other funds also experienced elevated trading activity, suggesting broad institutional engagement rather than isolated interest in a single product. The Fidelity Wise Origin Bitcoin Fund (FBTC) recorded approximately $6.8 billion in volume, while the ARK 21Shares Bitcoin ETF (ARKB) processed around $2.3 billion. This competitive dynamic has benefited investors through several mechanisms: Fee compression: Expense ratios have declined from initial levels Service improvement: Enhanced reporting and tax documentation Product innovation: Development of complementary options and futures products Educational outreach: Increased resources explaining cryptocurrency investing The competition among providers has accelerated infrastructure development and regulatory compliance, creating a more robust ecosystem for cryptocurrency exposure within traditional investment frameworks. This development represents a significant evolution from the early days of cryptocurrency investing, which required direct blockchain interaction and specialized technical knowledge. Regulatory Environment and Future Outlook The record trading volume occurs within an evolving regulatory landscape that continues to shape cryptocurrency market development. The Securities and Exchange Commission maintains active oversight of Bitcoin ETFs, requiring daily reporting, robust custody arrangements, and comprehensive risk disclosure. These requirements have established investor protection frameworks that distinguish regulated ETF products from direct cryptocurrency ownership or unregulated investment vehicles. Looking forward, market participants anticipate several developments that could further transform cryptocurrency ETF markets: Options trading: Regulatory approval for options on Bitcoin ETFs International expansion: Cross-listing on non-U.S. exchanges Product diversification: Ethereum and other cryptocurrency ETFs Retirement integration: Inclusion in 401(k) and IRA platforms Institutional adoption: Allocation by pension funds and endowments These developments would likely increase trading volumes further while potentially reducing volatility through diversified participation and sophisticated risk management tools. The maturation of cryptocurrency derivatives markets could provide additional hedging mechanisms for ETF market makers and large investors, potentially smoothing extreme price movements like the 13% decline observed on March 15. Conclusion BlackRock’s IBIT Bitcoin ETF has achieved a historic milestone with $10 billion in daily trading volume, demonstrating the substantial institutional infrastructure now supporting cryptocurrency investment vehicles. This record volume occurred alongside a brutal 13% price decline, highlighting the complex dynamics of maturing but still volatile digital asset markets. The event underscores both the remarkable progress in cryptocurrency market structure and the persistent volatility that characterizes this asset class. As regulatory frameworks evolve and institutional participation deepens, Bitcoin ETFs like IBIT will likely continue playing a crucial role in bridging traditional finance with digital assets, potentially setting new volume records while navigating the inherent volatility of cryptocurrency markets. FAQs Q1: What does $10 billion in daily trading volume mean for BlackRock’s IBIT Bitcoin ETF? This record volume indicates massive institutional and retail participation, robust market infrastructure capable of handling large transactions, and significant liquidity that benefits all investors through reduced trading costs and efficient price discovery. Q2: Why did IBIT’s price drop 13% on the same day it set volume records? The price decline resulted from broader cryptocurrency market volatility, macroeconomic concerns about inflation, regulatory uncertainty, technical resistance levels, and profit-taking by early investors, while the high volume reflected substantial transaction activity amid these market conditions. Q3: How does IBIT’s trading volume compare to traditional ETFs? While still below the largest traditional ETFs like SPY, IBIT’s $10 billion volume places it among the top tier of all ETFs by daily activity, demonstrating cryptocurrency ETFs have achieved mainstream trading levels within just over a year of approval. Q4: What are the implications of this volume record for cryptocurrency market maturity? The record volume indicates sophisticated market infrastructure, efficient arbitrage mechanisms between ETFs and underlying assets, substantial liquidity provision, and institutional-grade trading capabilities that support further mainstream adoption. Q5: How might this event affect future Bitcoin ETF development and regulation? Regulators may view the high volume as evidence of sufficient market depth for additional cryptocurrency products, while asset managers may accelerate development of related investment vehicles, potentially including options, international listings, and additional cryptocurrency exposures. This post BlackRock’s IBIT Bitcoin ETF Shatters Records with $10B Daily Volume Amid Brutal Market Drop first appeared on BitcoinWorld .

title: Reddit AI Search: The Bold Bet That Could Redefine Online Discovery and Drive Massive Revenue
body: BitcoinWorld Reddit AI Search: The Bold Bet That Could Redefine Online Discovery and Drive Massive Revenue In a strategic pivot that could reshape its financial future, Reddit has identified its AI-powered search capabilities as the company’s next monumental opportunity. During its fourth-quarter 2025 earnings call, executives outlined a vision where generative AI search becomes a core revenue driver, moving beyond its traditional social media roots. This announcement, made on Thursday, February 27, 2025, signals a profound shift for the platform as it leverages its unique community-driven data to compete in the lucrative search market. Reddit AI Search: From Community Forum to Search Powerhouse Reddit’s transformation is accelerating. The company is actively merging its traditional search engine with its generative AI feature, Reddit Answers. CEO Steve Huffman articulated a clear distinction between search paradigms. He described traditional search as navigation—a tool for finding specific links or subreddits. Conversely, he positioned Reddit’s AI search as superior for complex, subjective queries requiring multiple human perspectives. “There’s a type of query we’re, I think, particularly good at—I would argue, the best on the internet—which is questions that have no answers, where the answer actually is multiple perspectives from lots of people,” Huffman stated. The company believes generative AI search will ultimately prove “better for most queries.” This confidence stems from the platform’s vast repository of human experience and debate, a dataset uniquely suited for training large language models (LLMs) to provide nuanced, context-rich responses. Explosive User Growth and Strategic Monetization The potential is underscored by remarkable user adoption metrics. Weekly active users for Reddit’s overall search function grew 30% year-over-year, surging from 60 million to 80 million. More strikingly, the weekly active users for the AI-specific Reddit Answers feature exploded from 1 million in Q1 2025 to 15 million by Q4. This growth trajectory highlights a rapid user shift toward AI-assisted discovery on the platform. Although search remains unmonetized, Reddit’s leadership explicitly called it “an enormous market and opportunity.” The path to revenue is twofold. First, the company plans to enhance and directly monetize the search experience for users. Second, and already operational, is its content licensing business. This division allows other AI companies to legally train their models on Reddit’s data, creating a lucrative B2B revenue stream. The Data Licensing Goldmine and Platform Evolution Reddit’s “other” revenue segment, which includes AI data licensing, tells a compelling story. It increased 8% year-over-year in Q4 2025 to $36 million. For the full year 2025, this segment reached $140 million, representing a substantial 22% increase. This revenue provides critical diversification beyond advertising, insulating the company from market volatility. Concurrently, Reddit is fundamentally re-engineering the user experience. A landmark change, set for Q3 2026, will eliminate the distinction between logged-in and logged-out users. The platform will use AI and machine learning to personalize content dynamically for every visitor, aiming to make the site immediately relevant. This move could dramatically expand its total addressable market by capturing users who arrive via search engines but do not create accounts. Technical Advancements and Future Roadmap Reddit’s technical teams have made “significant progress” in unifying core search with its AI feature. The company is modernizing Reddit Answers to deliver more media-rich responses, moving beyond plain text. Pilots are already testing dynamic AI agents and search results that incorporate images, videos, and interactive elements. Furthermore, Reddit Answers expanded its linguistic reach in Q4, launching support for five new languages to capture a global audience. The following table summarizes Reddit’s key AI search growth metrics from 2025: Metric Q1 2025 Q4 2025 Growth Weekly Active Users (Overall Search) 60 million 80 million +30% Weekly Active Users (Reddit Answers AI) 1 million 15 million +1400% “Other” Revenue (Annual) $115M (2024) $140M (2025) +22% This data illustrates the compound growth strategy: scaling user engagement while simultaneously building a high-margin data business. The company’s approach avoids putting all its eggs in one basket, instead creating multiple potential revenue funnels from its AI investments. Competitive Landscape and Market Implications Reddit’s foray into AI search places it in direct competition with tech giants like Google, Microsoft (with Bing and Copilot), and emerging AI-native search startups. However, Reddit’s competitive moat is its authentic, human-generated content. For queries about personal experiences, product recommendations, troubleshooting, and nuanced debates, Reddit’s data pool is arguably unrivaled. By leveraging AI to synthesize this content, Reddit aims to offer a search product that giants cannot easily replicate without access to similar community dynamics. The broader implication is the potential fragmentation of the search market. Instead of a single destination for all queries, users may gravitate toward specialized vertical search engines. Reddit is positioning itself as the dominant player for experiential and opinion-based search, a massive category currently underserved by traditional link-based engines. Conclusion Reddit’s bold bet on AI search represents a strategic evolution from a social discussion platform to an indispensable knowledge discovery engine. By harnessing its unique data asset through generative AI, the company is unlocking a dual-revenue model combining user-facing services and enterprise data licensing. The explosive growth of Reddit Answers and the strategic removal of user barriers signal a company preparing for massive scale. While the full monetization of Reddit AI search remains on the horizon, the foundational growth, technical progress, and clear strategic vision detailed in its 2025 earnings suggest this initiative could fundamentally redefine Reddit’s business and become a significant new pillar in the future of online search. FAQs Q1: What is Reddit’s AI search engine called? Reddit’s generative AI search feature is called Reddit Answers . The company is actively merging it with its traditional search engine to create a unified, AI-enhanced search experience. Q2: How is Reddit planning to make money from AI search? Reddit envisions a two-pronged revenue strategy. First, by eventually monetizing the AI search product for its users. Second, and currently active, is its content licensing business , where it sells access to its data for other companies to train their own AI models, which generated $140 million in revenue in 2025. Q3: How popular is Reddit’s AI search feature? User adoption is growing rapidly. Weekly active users for the Reddit Answers AI feature skyrocketed from 1 million in Q1 2025 to 15 million by Q4 2025 . Overall search on Reddit grew to 80 million weekly active users. Q4: What major user change is Reddit planning for 2026? Starting in Q3 2026, Reddit will eliminate the distinction between logged-in and logged-out users . Using AI, it will personalize the site for every visitor, aiming to capture and engage users who arrive via search without requiring an account. Q5: How does Reddit’s AI search differ from Google’s? According to CEO Steve Huffman, Reddit’s AI search excels at subjective queries that benefit from multiple human perspectives —questions with no single right answer. He contrasts this with traditional search, which he views as better for navigational tasks like finding a specific website or link. This post Reddit AI Search: The Bold Bet That Could Redefine Online Discovery and Drive Massive Revenue first appeared on BitcoinWorld .

title: Governments Will Try to Buy 1 Million Bitcoin Each Within 3 Years: Pantera CEO
body: Pantera Capital CEO Dan Morehead told attendees at Ondo’s conference that sovereign competition could become the next big driver of bitcoin demand, predicting what he called a “global arms race” for BTC “within the next two or three years” as countries rethink reserve strategy in a more fractured geopolitical environment. “I would say my one very out of consensus view is I think there will be a global arms race for Bitcoin within the next two or three years,” Morehead said . “Countries like the United States are establishing strategic Bitcoin reserves. Countries that are aligned with us like the UAE are acquiring cryptocurrencies, Bitcoin.” He argued the larger shift would come when adversarial blocs decide it’s strategically reckless to warehouse national savings in assets seen as vulnerable to US pressure. “The big one though is… countries that are antagonistic to the United States will realize like China , super crazy to have a thousand years of your life savings stored in an asset that Scott Bessent can’t cancel,” Morehead said. “That is crazy. It’s way smarter to buy Bitcoin.” Morehead then sketched out the scale he believes could follow. “I think within two or three years there will be an arms race with three or four groups, regions each trying to buy a million bitcoins,” he said. “and you just want to be long before that happens.” Morehead Stays Structurally Bullish On Bitcoin After the arms-race thesis, Morehead stepped back to explain why he thinks recent market weakness fits a familiar pattern rather than a broken narrative. He admitted 2025 surprised him given what he described as a more favorable policy backdrop. “If you had asked me on New Year’s Day 2025… you would have said crypto up or down I would have said up and it was down 9% last year,” he said. His takeaway: crypto still trades in hype cycles, and the psychology repeats. “This is actually our fourth cycle in 13 years of trading,” he said, describing the swing from “we all think we’re geniuses” in bull markets to “it’s failed” in down markets. The antidote, he argued, is time horizon: “five ten years down the road” and respect for bitcoin’s four-year rhythm . Morehead pointed to a past Pantera call as evidence the cycle framework can still map price behavior. The firm projected bitcoin would hit $117,452 on Aug. 11, 2025—“and it did literally that day,” he said. He also acknowledged the usual temptation to declare an exception: “I was like, ‘Oh, no. This time’s different.’” Then he added: “and it wasn’t different.” On demand, Morehead highlighted two relatively new channels that, in his view, pulled forward large amounts of buying: “publicly listed ETFs and then publicly listed digit[al] treasury companies .” He said investors “piled into them” and that “collectively they bought over a hundred billion of crypto,” before suggesting the market can cool once that first wave is absorbed. Morehead’s longer-term case centered on monetary debasement and bitcoin’s fixed supply. “The willingness of all constituents just to print money is just off the charts now,” he said. He described steady erosion in fiat purchasing power as a rational catalyst for hard-asset allocation. “Paper money is being debased at 3% every year,” he said, arguing that it makes assets with constrained supply like gold or bitcoin structurally attractive. He also addressed the gold-versus-bitcoin tug-of-war, saying rotations are normal and pointing to ETF flows as evidence both trades are now institutionalized. “The total inflows to ETFs for both gold… and digital gold, Bitcoin are about the same over the last couple years,” he said. Over a longer horizon, his conviction was explicit: “In 10 years from now, Bitcoin will massively outperform gold.” On institutions, Morehead argued skepticism at the top remains a bullish signal because positioning is still light. “How can you have a bubble nobody owns?” he said, adding that “the median holding for institutional investors… is literally 0.0.” In his view, the list of reasons to avoid bitcoin has shortened dramatically, even if adoption at the largest firms is lagging. At press time, BTC traded at $69,418.
tags: Bitcoin News|bitcoin|bitcoin news|bitcoin price|btc|BTC news|btc price|Dan Morehead|Pantera Capital

title: Shiba Inu (SHIB) Poised for Price Recovery. Here’s the Signal
body: Shiba Inu (SHIB) is currently trading near a key long-term support level. This has drawn attention from market analysts watching for signs of a possible recovery. Although the broader cryptocurrency market has been under pressure, recent price action suggests that SHIB may be stabilizing , provided selling activity continues to ease. Over the past several days, the asset has struggled with sustained downward pressure , reflecting a wider market downturn that has particularly affected meme coins. The token has declined by over 7% within the last 24 hours, mirroring weakness seen across major digital assets. Despite this, SHIB has stayed above the price floor, which has acted as a support zone in the past. Market commentator MMBTrader views this as a positive signal for the token. While leading cryptocurrencies such as Bitcoin and Ethereum have pushed to new short-term lows, Shiba Inu has not fallen below its late January low near $0.00000616. Instead, price movements indicate a narrowing range around the $0.0000060 region. This behavior is often associated with consolidation, a phase in which buying and selling pressure temporarily finds a balance before a clearer trend begins. Investor Confidence The market commentator has highlighted this zone as a key weekly support level. According to his assessment, Shiba Inu’s ability to remain above this threshold despite persistent selling pressure suggests that market participants may be accumulating the asset rather than exiting positions completely. This is further reinforced by recent on-chain data showing a slight decline in SHIB balances held on centralized exchanges. A reduction in exchange reserves generally suggests that investors are transferring tokens into private wallets, which is often seen as a sign of longer-term holding. This view is strengthened by exchange flow metrics, which show that withdrawals have exceeded deposits over the past day. When examined together, these data points suggest that some large holders are positioning cautiously rather than preparing to sell into market weakness. We are on X, follow us to connect with us :- @TimesTabloid1 — TimesTabloid (@TimesTabloid1) June 15, 2025 MMBTrader has outlined a scenario in which continued price stability at this support level could set the stage for a bullish reversal. He argues that the current structure allows for a potential upward move if selling pressure diminishes and buyers maintain control of the range. Based on his technical projections, an initial recovery could lead to a price increase of up to 100% from the current zone, placing Shiba Inu above the $0.000010 level. Beyond this initial target, the analyst’s long-term forecasts show more ambitious price levels if bullish momentum strengthens over time. These scenarios include moves toward the $0.000033 and $0.000054 ranges, followed by an even higher extension above $0.000070 if broader market conditions support sustained growth. However, these outcomes are framed as conditional rather than guaranteed. The Effect of Bitcoin’s Performance on SHIB The broader cryptocurrency market, specifically Bitcoin’s performance, still has an influence over Shiba Inu. Bitcoin recently dropped below the $70,000 mark, a level that has not been recorded in over one year . If the asset continues to show weakness, it could undermine any recovery attempt Shiba Inu makes, regardless of its technical setup. Analysts emphasize that Shiba Inu’s outlook depends on the preservation of its weekly support level and a reduction in overall market selling pressure. While early signs of accumulation are present, confirmation would require consistent price stability and improved sentiment across the wider market. title: DipCoin Launches Season 1: Horizon (Points & Referral System), an Incentive Framework for Perpetual Trading
body: San Francisco, CA, USA, February 6th, 2026, Chainwire DipCoin today announced the official launch of its Season 1: Horizon Points & Referral System, marking the activation of DipCoin’s long-term incentive framework designed to reward real trading participation, capital contribution, and community growth across its perpetual and Vault ecosystem. Season 1: Horizon represents more than a limited-time promotion. It establishes the foundational scoring logic, risk controls, and reward architecture that will guide DipCoin’s incentive programs across future seasons. The system is built to align user rewards with meaningful platform activity (trading, liquidity commitment, position management, and referrals) while discouraging short-term manipulation and low-quality participation. With Horizon, DipCoin takes a step toward transforming incentives from short-term marketing campaigns into a structured, sustainable ecosystem engine. A New Chapter: Why “Horizon” “Horizon” symbolizes the beginning of DipCoin’s transition from a standalone perpetual trading platform into a contribution-driven ecosystem. Rather than focusing only on trading volume, Season 1 expands reward eligibility to multiple forms of participation, recognizing that healthy markets are built on more than just transactions. This season marks the first official deployment of DipCoin’s long-term points system, which will serve as a core reference for all future seasons and ecosystem benefit distribution. Season 1 Schedule All Season 1 calculations follow UTC time: Start: February 4, 2026 - 00:00 UTC End: March 20, 2026 - 23:59:59 UTC The DipCoin interface automatically converts these times to each user’s local timezone for convenience. What Users Can Earn Points For Season 1: Horizon quantifies real participation through four core activity categories inside DipCoin’s Perp Accounts and Vault Accounts: TVL Points (Deposit Contribution) Generated from average daily deposited balances. Trading Volume Points (Trading Activity) Generated from executed perpetual trades and Vault strategy execution. Position Holding Points (Position Size Contribution) Generated from average daily effective position size. Liquidation Points (Loss-Based Conversion Points) Generated when forced liquidations occur and result in real losses. Only Perp and Vault activity is included. Swap trades are excluded from Season 1 calculations. This design ensures that rewards reflect real economic engagement rather than surface-level activity. Early Bird Rewards: Honoring Early Supporters To recognize users who traded on DipCoin before Season 1 officially begins, the platform includes historical data as Early Bird Rewards: Included historical data: Trading volume points Liquidation loss points These historical points receive a 3× multiplier and appear in the Early Bird Rewards section of each user’s dashboard. TVL, position holding, team boosts, and referrals are not included in Early Bird calculations. How Total Season Points Are Calculated Season Points consist of four components: Base Points Boosted Points Referral Rewards Early Bird Rewards Boosted Points are derived from team participation: Boosted Points = Daily Base Points × (Team Multiplier − 1) Final Season Points = Daily Base Points + Boosted Points + Referral Rewards + Early Bird Rewards (accumulated across the season) Welcome Points for New Users New users who bind a wallet using an invitation code receive a 3-day Welcome Bonus: All Base Points earn 2x during the first three natural days. The bonus applies to: TVL Points Trading Volume Points Position Holding Points Liquidation Points If a user invites others during the Welcome period, the 2× bonus still applies on that day. From the following day onward, the user transitions to standard inviter status and begins earning referral rewards instead. Team Acceleration System DipCoin introduces a team-based acceleration model that rewards collaborative growth. Each user may: Create one team Join one team Users can simultaneously hold inviter and invitee roles. The system compares both team multipliers and applies the higher value as the user’s effective multiplier. Team Participation Requirements For a directly invited member to contribute toward team acceleration: Daily trading volume ≥ 2,000 USDC Daily average position size ≥ 500 USDC This ensures that team growth is driven by real traders, not passive or shell wallets. Inviters’ own points are not counted toward their team’s total. Referral Rebate Rewards Inviters receive: 10% of the Base Points generated by each qualified direct invitee. Only invitees who accumulate at least 20 Base Points are eligible to generate referral rewards. Referral rewards are additive and do not reduce the invitee’s own points. Post-Season Settlement After Season 1 concludes: Season data is frozen. Risk review and verification are completed within 7 business days. Final confirmed results are published and reflected in user dashboards. Season 1 points will be archived for historical reference. New seasons will start with fresh accumulation. Why This Matters Many points programs reward raw volume alone. DipCoin’s Horizon system rewards capital commitment, position exposure, trading activity, and community building together. This multi-dimensional design reflects how real markets function and encourages behavior that strengthens liquidity, depth, and long-term platform health. Season 1: Horizon sets the baseline for how DipCoin plans to distribute ecosystem value going forward. How to Participate Season 1: Horizon began February 4, 2026 (00:00 UTC). Users can start earning points by: Depositing into Perp or Vault accounts Trading perpetual contracts Holding positions Participating in Vault strategies Inviting qualified users Users can learn more and get started at: https://dipcoin.io About DipCoin DipCoin is a decentralized perpetual trading protocol built on Sui, focused on delivering fully on-chain, non-custodial perpetual markets with professional-grade execution and transparent infrastructure. DipCoin is building trading primitives and strategy participation tools designed for long-term on-chain market participants. ContactCMOBobby HoDipcoinbobby.ho@dipcoin.io Disclaimer: This is a sponsored press release and is for informational purposes only. It does not reflect the views of Crypto Daily, nor is it intended to be used as legal, tax, investment, or financial advice.

title: Polygon Hits $3.50 Billion In Payments As Crypto Activity Expands
body: Reports have disclosed that Polygon closed the final quarter of 2025 with higher on-chain usage, driven by payments, stablecoin transfers, and tokenized assets. Related Reading: Crypto Could Bounce Soon As Fundamentals Firm Up, Tom Lee Says While traders watched MATIC drift inside a narrow range, activity on the chain told a different story, one focused on payments, stablecoins, and quiet institutional adoption rather than price momentum. Polygon Payments Use Grows Faster Than Prices According to Messari’s Q4 network review released on January 4, Polygon processed heavy payment traffic as fees stayed low and settlement times remained short. More than 50 apps built for payments handled about $3.50 billion in transfers during the quarter. That figure was 96% higher than the prior quarter and close to four times the level seen a year earlier. Stablecoin-linked cards added another layer of activity. Ten card programs together moved nearly $363 million using Mastercard and Visa rails, with Visa responsible for the larger share. Reports say this growth came from everyday spending rather than one-off events, a sign that Polygon is being used for routine transfers instead of short-term experiments. Beyond card payments, several firms expanded how they move money on the chain. DeCard allowed users to pay with USDC and USDT at a wide range of merchants. Flutterwave chose Polygon for cross-border business payments in 30 African countries. Revolut integrated cheap stablecoin transfers inside its app, while Stripe continued building subscription tools that rely on USDC. None of those moves grabbed market headlines, yet together they pushed steady volume through the network. Tokenized Assets Gain Ground Quietly Away from payments, tokenized real-world assets continued to stack up. Reports note Polygon ended Q4 with nearly $1.10 billion in RWAs, ranking ninth worldwide. Growth was driven less by retail hype and more by regulated structures. Stablecoin supply climbed to nearly 3 billion, led by USDC at $1.34 billion and DAI near $630 million. Latin America stood out as a key region, where non-USD stablecoin volume totaled $1.18 billion. Average daily DEX volume jumped 44% to a little over $200 million. MATICUSD trading at $0.19 on the 24-hour chart: TradingView MATIC Trades Sideways As Activity Builds MATIC’s price action stayed restrained despite the on-chain growth. The token slipped back from short-term resistance during broader market weakness and then stabilized as buyers defended key support zones. Related Reading: Russia’s Biggest Exchange To Launch XRP Indices And Futures Deeper losses were avoided, but strong upside moves failed to appear. Volume has yet to confirm a shift in trend. For now, Polygon shows rising use across payments and tokenized assets, while its token waits for a clearer signal from traders. Featured image from Unsplash, chart from TradingView

title: Bitcoin Price Plummets: BTC Falls Below $63,000 Amidst Market Uncertainty
body: BitcoinWorld Bitcoin Price Plummets: BTC Falls Below $63,000 Amidst Market Uncertainty Global cryptocurrency markets witnessed a significant shift on April 2, 2025, as the Bitcoin price fell decisively below the $63,000 threshold. According to real-time data from Bitcoin World market monitoring, BTC is currently trading at $62,900 on the Binance USDT perpetual futures market. This movement represents a crucial test for the digital asset’s recent consolidation phase and prompts a detailed examination of underlying market forces. Bitcoin Price Action and Immediate Market Context The descent of the Bitcoin price below $63,000 did not occur in isolation. Consequently, analysts are scrutinizing several concurrent factors. Trading volume across major exchanges has shown notable divergence in the preceding 24 hours. Furthermore, the global cryptocurrency market capitalization has experienced a correlated dip of approximately 3.2%. This specific price level, $63,000, previously acted as both support and resistance throughout Q1 2025, making its breach a technically significant event. Market data reveals specific patterns for this BTC price movement: Exchange Flow: Net outflows from centralized exchanges increased by 18% in the 12 hours preceding the drop. Derivatives Market: Open Interest in BTC futures contracts declined slightly, suggesting some leverage unwinding. Dominance: Bitcoin’s market dominance held relatively steady near 52%, indicating a broad market move rather than an altcoin rotation. Recent Bitcoin Price Levels (Key Support/Resistance) Level Role in Q1 2025 Status as of April 2 $67,500 Resistance Not Tested $63,000 Support/Resistance Broken (Support) $60,000 Major Support Next Key Level $58,200 Long-term Trend Support Untouched Analyzing the Drivers Behind Cryptocurrency Volatility Multiple macro and micro-economic elements consistently influence cryptocurrency market volatility. Firstly, traditional finance correlations have re-emerged. The U.S. Dollar Index (DXY) strengthened by 0.8% overnight, applying pressure to dollar-denominated assets like Bitcoin. Secondly, bond yields saw an uptick, potentially diverting capital from speculative assets. Additionally, sector-specific news flow has been neutral to slightly negative, lacking major institutional adoption announcements that previously fueled rallies. Regulatory developments also provide essential context. For instance, ongoing discussions about digital asset frameworks in major economies create uncertainty. Moreover, comments from central bank officials regarding digital currencies often trigger short-term sentiment shifts. The market is currently digesting the implications of the latest Basel Committee guidance on bank crypto exposures. Historical Precedent and Cycle Analysis Examining past Bitcoin price behavior offers valuable perspective. Historically, corrections of 10-20% within broader bull market trends are common. The current pullback from the Q1 2025 high of approximately $69,200 represents a decline of around 9%. Notably, similar corrections in 2023 and 2024 were followed by periods of consolidation before resuming upward trajectories, provided fundamental adoption metrics remained strong. On-chain data provides a more nuanced view than price alone. Metrics like the Spent Output Profit Ratio (SOPR) and Network Value to Transactions (NVT) ratio help gauge whether the move is driven by profit-taking or fundamental weakening. Preliminary analysis suggests a mix of short-term profit realization and derivative market rebalancing, rather than a mass exodus of long-term holders. Potential Impacts on the Broader Digital Asset Ecosystem The movement of the primary cryptocurrency invariably affects the entire digital asset space. Altcoins, particularly those with high correlation to Bitcoin, typically experience amplified volatility. However, some decentralized finance (DeFi) tokens and layer-1 blockchain native assets have recently shown lower correlation coefficients, suggesting potential diversification benefits. Meanwhile, institutional activity often pauses during such volatility, awaiting clearer price discovery. Mining economics also feel immediate effects. A lower Bitcoin price squeezes miner margins, especially for operators with higher energy costs. This pressure can lead to a short-term increase in Bitcoin selling from miners to cover operational expenses, potentially creating a feedback loop. Conversely, it can also accelerate efficiency upgrades within the mining industry. Expert Perspectives on Market Structure and Trader Sentiment Market analysts emphasize the importance of distinguishing between technical corrections and trend reversals. Several trading desks reported increased sell-side liquidity around the $63,500 level, which eventually overwhelmed buy orders. Options market data shows a rise in implied volatility, indicating traders are pricing in greater near-term price swings. The put/call ratio for weekly Bitcoin options shifted slightly, reflecting a modest increase in hedging activity. Sentiment indicators from various analytics platforms show a shift from “Greed” to “Neutral” on the traditional fear and greed index. Social media analysis reveals a corresponding increase in cautious commentary among retail traders. However, long-term holder addresses continue to accumulate, suggesting foundational belief in the asset’s value proposition remains intact. Conclusion The Bitcoin price falling below $63,000 marks a pivotal moment for market participants in April 2025. This event underscores the inherent volatility of the cryptocurrency market while testing key technical levels. Analysis of on-chain data, derivatives activity, and macro-financial correlations provides a comprehensive picture beyond the headline price. The market’s reaction in the coming days, particularly around the $60,000 support zone, will be critical for determining the short-to-medium-term trend. Ultimately, such movements highlight the importance of robust risk management and a focus on long-term fundamentals over short-term price fluctuations in the digital asset space. FAQs Q1: Why did the Bitcoin price fall below $63,000? The drop appears driven by a combination of a stronger U.S. dollar, rising bond yields, derivative market rebalancing, and a lack of immediate positive catalysts, leading to a break of a key technical support level. Q2: Is this a normal correction for Bitcoin? Yes, historically, pullbacks of 10-20% are common within broader bullish trends. The current ~9% decline from recent highs aligns with typical market volatility. Q3: What is the next major support level for BTC? Analysts are watching the $60,000 psychological level closely, followed by more substantial support in the $58,000-$58,200 range, which aligns with longer-term moving averages. Q4: How does this affect other cryptocurrencies? Altcoins with high correlation to Bitcoin often experience similar or greater volatility. However, some sectors, like certain DeFi tokens, may demonstrate lower correlation during such events. Q5: Should long-term investors be concerned about this price movement? Long-term investment theses for Bitcoin typically focus on adoption, scarcity, and macro trends rather than short-term price swings. On-chain data shows long-term holder accumulation continues, suggesting foundational confidence remains. This post Bitcoin Price Plummets: BTC Falls Below $63,000 Amidst Market Uncertainty first appeared on BitcoinWorld .

title: World Liberty Financial’s Strategic $11.75M WBTC Divestment Signals Shifting Corporate Crypto Tactics
body: BitcoinWorld World Liberty Financial’s Strategic $11.75M WBTC Divestment Signals Shifting Corporate Crypto Tactics In a significant move within institutional cryptocurrency markets, World Liberty Financial (WLFI) has executed a substantial divestment of Wrapped Bitcoin (WBTC), selling an additional 100 tokens valued at $6.71 million. This transaction, reported by blockchain analytics firm Onchainlens on March 21, 2025, amplifies the company’s recent activity, bringing its total sales within a critical 10-hour window to 173 WBTC, equivalent to approximately $11.75 million. This development provides a compelling case study in corporate digital asset treasury management and its potential ripple effects across financial markets. World Liberty Financial’s Accelerated WBTC Divestment Strategy The recent sales data reveals a deliberate and accelerated strategy by World Liberty Financial. Initially, the company sold 73 WBTC. Subsequently, it executed a follow-up transaction for 100 WBTC. Consequently, the cumulative sales reached $11.75 million. This two-tiered approach suggests a planned liquidation rather than a reactionary sell-off. Corporate treasury movements of this scale warrant close examination. They often reflect broader strategic shifts in asset allocation. Furthermore, they can influence market sentiment toward Bitcoin as a corporate reserve asset. Wrapped Bitcoin (WBTC) serves as an ERC-20 token on the Ethereum blockchain. It represents Bitcoin on a 1:1 basis. This tokenization enables Bitcoin to function within the decentralized finance (DeFi) ecosystem. Institutions frequently utilize WBTC for its interoperability. World Liberty Financial’s choice of WBTC over native Bitcoin may indicate specific operational needs. These could include participation in lending protocols or liquidity pools. Alternatively, it may simply reflect the chosen custodian’s settlement mechanism. Analyzing the Corporate Cryptocurrency Landscape The actions of World Liberty Financial occur within a dynamic institutional landscape. Several public companies famously adopted Bitcoin as a treasury asset earlier this decade. Their strategies have since diverged significantly. Some maintain a steadfast hold. Others have engaged in periodic profit-taking or portfolio rebalancing. This sale by WLFI contributes to an ongoing narrative about the maturity of corporate crypto adoption. It highlights the transition from acquisition phases to active management phases. Key factors influencing such decisions typically include: Regulatory Clarity: Evolving accounting standards and tax treatment for digital assets. Liquidity Requirements: Corporate needs for cash flow or capital for other investments. Portfolio Rebalancing: Maintaining target asset allocations after significant price appreciation. Strategic Pivots: Shifting business focus away from direct crypto exposure. Market analysts monitor these flows diligently. Large, identifiable sales can temporarily increase selling pressure on exchanges. However, the overall impact often depends on market depth and concurrent buying activity. Expert Perspective on Treasury Management Signals Financial strategists emphasize that single transactions rarely tell the full story. “A sale is not inherently bearish,” notes a report from the Digital Asset Research Institute. “Corporate treasuries must manage risk and return like any portfolio. A divestment could fund a strategic acquisition, share buybacks, or debt reduction. It is essential to contextualize the sale within the company’s broader financial statements and stated strategy.” For instance, if the proceeds from this $11.75 million WBTC sale are deployed into higher-yielding ventures or used to strengthen the balance sheet, the move could be viewed as prudent capital management. Conversely, if it represents a full exit from digital assets, it might signal a loss of conviction. Without official commentary from World Liberty Financial, market participants rely on on-chain data and comparative analysis. The Mechanics and Market Impact of Large WBTC Sales Executing a multimillion-dollar WBTC sale requires careful orchestration. The seller must navigate liquidity venues to minimize slippage. This often involves using over-the-counter (OTC) desks or algorithmic trading to break the order into smaller chunks. The reported data from Onchainlens provides transparency. It allows the market to see the movement from the company’s known wallet address to an exchange or OTC settlement address. The immediate market impact of WLFI’s sales is measurable through several metrics: Metric Potential Impact Notes Bitcoin Price Short-term downward pressure Depends on order execution and market absorption. WBTC Supply Peg Minor deviation possible Large redemptions can test the 1:1 mint/redeem mechanism. Market Sentiment Neutral to slightly negative Institutional sales can influence retail trader psychology. Volatility Possible increase Large, visible transactions can trigger algorithmic trading responses. Historically, the market has absorbed similar-sized sales from other entities without sustained price deterioration. The underlying health of Bitcoin’s network and macroeconomic factors usually play a larger long-term role. Historical Context and Future Implications World Liberty Financial’s activity echoes patterns seen in previous market cycles. Early corporate adopters sometimes take profits after major rallies. This behavior aligns with traditional portfolio management principles. The critical question for observers is whether this marks a trend reversal or an isolated rebalancing act. Future on-chain monitoring will reveal if WLFI’s wallets receive further inflows of cryptocurrency or remain in a distribution phase. This event also underscores the growing importance of blockchain analytics. Firms like Onchainlens provide essential transparency. They turn public ledger data into actionable intelligence for investors, regulators, and journalists. This visibility itself may influence corporate behavior, encouraging more measured and disclosed approaches to managing digital treasuries. Conclusion World Liberty Financial’s sale of $6.71 million in WBTC, culminating in a total $11.75 million divestment over ten hours, represents a significant data point in the evolution of institutional cryptocurrency strategy. This move highlights the active management phase now underway for corporate digital asset holdings. While the specific motivations remain undisclosed, the transaction demonstrates the liquidity and operational reality of large-scale Bitcoin treasury management. The market’s response will hinge not on this single event, but on whether it heralds a broader shift in institutional sentiment or stands as an independent capital allocation decision. As transparency tools improve, such corporate actions will continue to provide valuable insight into the complex interplay between traditional finance and the digital asset ecosystem. FAQs Q1: What is Wrapped Bitcoin (WBTC)? WBTC is an ERC-20 token that represents Bitcoin on the Ethereum blockchain. Each WBTC is backed 1:1 by a real Bitcoin held in custody, allowing Bitcoin to be used in Ethereum-based applications like decentralized finance (DeFi) protocols. Q2: Why would a company like World Liberty Financial sell its WBTC? Companies may sell digital assets for various strategic reasons, including portfolio rebalancing, securing profits after price appreciation, raising capital for operations or investments, or adjusting to new regulatory or accounting standards. Q3: Does a large corporate sale mean the price of Bitcoin will drop? Not necessarily. While large sales can create temporary selling pressure, Bitcoin’s price is influenced by a vast array of factors including global macroeconomic conditions, overall market demand, regulatory news, and broader investor sentiment. The market often absorbs single-entity sales. Q4: How does Onchainlens track these transactions? Blockchain analytics firms like Onchainlens monitor public blockchain addresses known to belong to specific entities (like corporations). They track the movement of funds from these addresses to exchange deposit addresses or other known wallets, reporting large and noteworthy transactions. Q5: What is the difference between selling WBTC and selling native Bitcoin? Functionally, the economic effect is identical as both are pegged to Bitcoin’s price. However, WBTC exists on the Ethereum network, so selling it involves Ethereum gas fees and occurs within the ecosystem of Ethereum-based exchanges and DEXs. Selling native Bitcoin involves the Bitcoin network and its associated exchanges. This post World Liberty Financial’s Strategic $11.75M WBTC Divestment Signals Shifting Corporate Crypto Tactics first appeared on BitcoinWorld .

title: AI Agents Payments Revolution: Sapiom’s $15M Funding Unleashes Autonomous Tech Purchasing
body: BitcoinWorld AI Agents Payments Revolution: Sapiom’s $15M Funding Unleashes Autonomous Tech Purchasing In a significant development for artificial intelligence infrastructure, San Francisco-based startup Sapiom has secured $15 million in seed funding to solve a critical bottleneck in AI development: enabling autonomous agents to purchase their own technology tools. Announced on October 15, 2024, this investment round led by Accel with participation from Okta Ventures, Array Ventures, Menlo Ventures, Anthropic, and Coinbase Ventures addresses the growing need for financial layers that allow AI systems to independently access and pay for external services. The AI Payments Infrastructure Challenge As AI agents become increasingly sophisticated, they face a fundamental limitation: they cannot autonomously purchase the tools they need to function effectively. Currently, every API call, text message sent via Twilio, or server spun up on AWS requires manual authentication and payment setup. This creates significant friction for developers, particularly those using “vibe coding” platforms that allow non-technical creators to build applications through plain-language descriptions. Ilan Zerbib, Sapiom’s founder and former Shopify director of engineering for payments, identified this problem after observing the limitations of current development tools. “While prompt-to-code solutions can create impressive prototypes,” Zerbib explains, “launching them into full-scale production requires complex backend integrations that most non-technical creators cannot manage independently.” The Technical Barrier for Non-Technical Creators The rise of vibe coding platforms like Lovable has democratized application development, enabling people without coding backgrounds to create functional prototypes. However, these creators hit a wall when they need to integrate essential services. For instance, adding SMS capabilities requires manual Twilio integration, credit card registration, and API key management—processes that typically require technical expertise. Sapiom’s solution creates a financial layer that handles these complexities automatically. When an AI agent needs to send a text message, it can authenticate and pay for Twilio services through Sapiom’s infrastructure without human intervention. This approach transforms every API call into a seamless micro-transaction. How Sapiom’s Financial Layer Works Sapiom operates as an intermediary payment system specifically designed for AI-to-service transactions. The platform provides several key functions: Automated Authentication: Handles service authentication for AI agents Micro-payment Processing: Manages small transactions between AI systems and service providers Security Infrastructure: Ensures secure financial transactions between autonomous systems Billing Integration: Passes costs through to end-users via development platforms Amit Kumar, partner at Accel, emphasizes the significance of this approach. “Every API call is essentially a payment transaction,” Kumar states. “Currently, there’s no standardized way for AI agents to access and pay for the services they need autonomously. Sapiom is building the foundational infrastructure for this new paradigm.” Enterprise Focus and Market Positioning Unlike consumer-focused payment solutions, Sapiom specifically targets enterprise applications. This strategic focus addresses the immediate needs of businesses developing AI agents for operational tasks. The company initially partners with vibe-coding platforms, allowing them to offer seamless service integrations to their users. For example, a creator building a customer service application with SMS capabilities would traditionally need to manually integrate Twilio. With Sapiom, the vibe-coding platform handles this integration transparently, charging users for Twilio services as a pass-through fee. This eliminates technical barriers while maintaining service provider relationships. Investor Perspective and Market Validation The $15 million seed round represents significant validation from experienced technology investors. Accel’s leadership in the funding round reflects confidence in Sapiom’s enterprise-focused approach. Kumar notes that while he has evaluated numerous AI payment startups, Zerbib’s specific focus on the financial layer for business applications stands out as particularly valuable. Participation from strategic investors like Anthropic and Coinbase Ventures provides additional credibility. Anthropic’s involvement suggests recognition of the infrastructure needs for advanced AI systems, while Coinbase Ventures’ participation indicates blockchain and cryptocurrency expertise may inform future developments. Key Investors in Sapiom’s $15M Seed Round Investor Focus Area Strategic Value Accel (Lead) Venture Capital Enterprise software expertise Okta Ventures Identity Management Authentication infrastructure Array Ventures Early-stage Tech Infrastructure investments Menlo Ventures Technology Platform development experience Anthropic AI Research AI system requirements Coinbase Ventures Cryptocurrency Payment innovation The Broader AI Infrastructure Landscape Sapiom enters a rapidly evolving market for AI infrastructure tools. As AI agents become more capable, they require increasingly sophisticated support systems. The company’s financial layer complements other infrastructure developments, including: Agent orchestration platforms Memory and context management systems Tool integration frameworks Security and compliance solutions This infrastructure development follows a predictable pattern in technology evolution. Just as web development required payment processing solutions like Stripe, AI agent development now requires specialized financial infrastructure. Future Applications and Development Roadmap While Sapiom currently focuses on B2B solutions, the technology has broader implications. The same infrastructure that enables business AI agents to purchase services could eventually empower personal AI assistants. Individuals might one day trust AI agents to handle routine transactions like ordering transportation or making purchases. Zerbib maintains a pragmatic perspective about this potential. “AI won’t magically make people buy more things,” he notes. “Our immediate focus is solving real business problems by creating robust financial layers for enterprise applications.” The company’s development roadmap likely includes expanding service provider integrations, enhancing security protocols, and developing more sophisticated payment models. As AI agents take on more complex tasks, their financial infrastructure must evolve accordingly. Industry Impact and Adoption Timeline Early adoption will likely come from vibe-coding platforms seeking to enhance their value proposition. By integrating Sapiom’s technology, these platforms can offer more complete solutions to non-technical creators. This could accelerate the democratization of application development. Longer-term, Sapiom’s infrastructure could become standard for any platform developing AI agents. As Kumar observes, “If you really think about it, every API call is a payment. Creating seamless infrastructure for these transactions is essential for AI’s continued advancement.” Conclusion Sapiom’s $15 million funding round represents a significant milestone in AI infrastructure development. By creating specialized financial layers for autonomous AI transactions, the company addresses a critical bottleneck in AI agent functionality. This enterprise-focused approach to AI agents payments enables non-technical creators to build more sophisticated applications while providing the infrastructure needed for future AI advancements. As AI systems become increasingly autonomous, solutions like Sapiom’s will become essential components of the technological landscape, enabling seamless interactions between intelligent systems and the services they require to function effectively. FAQs Q1: What problem does Sapiom solve for AI developers? Sapiom solves the financial infrastructure challenge that prevents AI agents from autonomously purchasing and accessing external services like APIs, data, and compute resources. It eliminates manual authentication and payment setup for each service integration. Q2: How does Sapiom benefit non-technical application creators? Non-technical creators using vibe coding platforms can build applications that integrate services like SMS or payment processing without manual technical work. Sapiom handles the backend financial transactions automatically. Q3: What distinguishes Sapiom from other payment solutions? Sapiom specifically focuses on AI-to-service transactions rather than consumer payments. It creates infrastructure for micro-transactions between autonomous systems and service providers, with enterprise applications as the primary focus. Q4: How will Sapiom generate revenue? Sapiom will likely charge transaction fees or platform licensing fees to development platforms that integrate its technology. These costs would be passed through to end-users as part of service fees. Q5: What are the security implications of AI agents making autonomous purchases? Sapiom must implement robust security protocols, including spending limits, approval workflows, and audit trails. The enterprise focus means initial implementations will include organizational controls and compliance features. This post AI Agents Payments Revolution: Sapiom’s $15M Funding Unleashes Autonomous Tech Purchasing first appeared on BitcoinWorld .
